intro: Oldenlandia linearis, commonly known as the threadleaf mistletoe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on the surface of other plants without deriving nutrients from them. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are linear and narrow, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
